creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: square form with indented corners; lid carved with 2 figures at R in a landscape with buildings at L and UR corner; sides of lid and 3 compartments carved with flowers; base has a raised, sloping foot; red lacquer
text: This four-lobed square box is comprised of four stacking compartments, the lowermost with a flat base set on a raised sloping foot. The deeply carved cover depicts an elderly scholar holding a scepter followed by a young attendant with a ch'in zither under his arm. The two are making their way to a terraced pavilion set amongst rocks and pines. A full moon is ascendant and the whole scene is set against air (sky) and water diaper patterns. The sides of the cover and compartments are each carved with four flowers: chrysanthemum, peony, camellia, and pomegranate. All the floral designs are set against a plain yellow-brown ground. Decorative containers like this could have held any number of small items, but they were not always put to practical use.
title: Tiered Box
